name: caroline
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
from or relating to the period of British history during the rule of King Charles I (1625-1649): The Caroline era followed the Jacobean era and overlapped with the English Civil War. During the Caroline period the cavalier poets (such as John Suckling) and the metaphysical poets (such as George Herbert) flourished.
from or relating to the period of British history during the rule of King Charles III (from 2022): The period of King Charles III's rule could be known either as the second Caroline or second Carolean era. Compare
Carolean
Elizabethan
Georgian
Jacobean
Victorian
More examplesFewer examplesThere was Scottish resistance to Caroline reforms, ending with the 1639 and 1640 Bishops' Wars.
